intro: Argostemma platyphyllum, commonly known as the broad-leaved argostemma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
